Perfect for:

• UI/UX designers working across different measurement systems

• Creating responsive designs that require precise unit conversions

• Print and digital designers who need to convert between physical and digital units

• Anyone who wants to save time on manual calculations

Stop wasting time with manual calculations or switching between apps. Unit Converter Pro handles all your measurement conversion needs in one place, letting you focus on what matters most - your designs.

Convert any unit with just a few clicks and design with confidence!

plugins.name: Stopwatch
plugins.description:
A simple stopwatch timer that counts up from zero and continuously updates your selected text layer in real time.

Great for prototyping timers, showing elapsed time, or just tracking activity in your design!


🔧 Features:

Live stopwatch with hh:mm:ss format

Start, Stop, and Reset controls

Automatically updates the selected text node in Figma

Lightweight and easy to use


📚 Instructions for Use

  1. Select a text layer in your Figma file
  2. Run the plugin: Plugins → Stopwatch Timer
  3. Click Start to begin counting up
  4. The time will update in your selected layer every second
  5. Use Stop to pause or Reset to clear the timer


📝 Note: Make sure the text node uses a single font like “Inter Semi Bold”. The plugin automatically loads the required font.
plugins.tagline: A simple stopwatch that updates your Figma layers in real time.

plugins.name: Text Style Mapping
plugins.description:
Text Style Mapping simplifies the process of applying text styles to multiple text layers in your Figma designs.


Features:

  1. Apply text styles to both styled and unstyled text layers at once
  2. Automatically groups similar unstyled text based on font family, weight, size, and line height
  3. Switch between styled and unstyled text with an easy tab interface
  4. Works with your existing text styles library


How to use:

  1. Select a frame containing text elements
  2. Choose text styles from the dropdown menus
  3. Click "Apply Styles" to update all selected text layers at once


Note: This plugin may have limitations when working with text styles that use design tokens or local variables due to Figma API constraints.


This plugin helps maintain design consistency by making text styling quick and efficient across your Figma designs.


-


Text Style Mappingは、Figmaデザイン内の複数のテキストレイヤーにテキストスタイルを適用するプロセスを簡素化します。


機能：

  1. スタイル適用済みおよび未適用のテキストレイヤーに一度にスタイルを適用
  2. フォントファミリー、ウェイト、サイズ、行間に基づいて類似のスタイル未適用テキストを自動的にグループ化
  3. 使いやすいタブインターフェースでスタイル適用済みと未適用テキストを切り替え
  4. 既存のテキストスタイルライブラリと連携


使い方：

  1. テキスト要素を含むフレームを選択
  2. ドロップダウンメニューからテキストスタイルを選択
  3. 「Apply Styles」をクリックして、選択したすべてのテキストレイヤーを一度に更新


注意：このプラグインは、Figma APIの制約により、デザイントークンやローカル変数を使用するテキストスタイルでは制限がある場合があります。


このプラグインは、Figmaデザイン全体でテキストスタイリングを迅速かつ効率的に行い、デザインの一貫性を維持するのに役立ちます。
plugins.tagline: Batch apply text styles to multiple text layers in Figma.

plugins.name: Find Components
plugins.description:
このFigmaプラグイン「Find Components」は、選択した複数のレイヤーの中からメインコンポーネント/インスタンスを効率的に選出するのに役立ちます。


主な機能：

  1. メインコンポーネント/インスタンスの絞り込み： 選択したレイヤーの中から、メインコンポーネント/インスタンスのみを抽出して選択できます。
  2. 選択対象の切り替え： ドロップダウンメニューから、メインコンポーネント/インスタンスのどちらを選択対象とするかを選択できます。
  3. グループ化されたレイヤーにも対応： グループ化されたレイヤーの奥深くにネストされたコンポーネント/インスタンスも探し出して選択できます。
  4. 処理のキャンセル： 実行処理が重い場合でも、途中で処理をキャンセルできます。


このプラグインは、以下のような場面で役立ちます：

  1. - デザインシステムの整理： 大量のコンポーネント/インスタンスの中から、特定のものを効率的に見つけたい場合。
  2. デザインの更新： 複数のインスタンスをまとめてメインコンポーネントにリンクさせたい場合。
  3. 共同作業： チームメンバーが作成したコンポーネントやインスタンスを、効率的に把握したい場合。


---


This Figma plugin, "Find Components," helps you efficiently select main components or instances from multiple selected layers.


Key features:

  1. Component/Instance filtering: You can extract and select only main components or instances from the selected layers.
  2. Selection target switching: You can choose whether to target main components or instances from the dropdown menu.
  3. Support for grouped layers: You can find and select components or instances nested deep within grouped layers.
  4. Process cancellation: You can cancel the process midway if the execution process is heavy.


This plugin is useful in the following situations:

  1. Organizing design systems: When you want to efficiently find specific components or instances from a large number of them.
  2. Updating designs: When you want to link multiple instances to the main component at once.
  3. Collaboration: When you want to efficiently understand the components and instances created by team members.

plugins.name: Layer Formatter
plugins.description:
Streamline your design-to-development workflow with Layer Formatter, a powerful tool that simplifies layer renaming. Whether you need hyphens, underscores, camel case, or kebab case, this tool ensures your layers align perfectly with coding conventions.


Say goodbye to messy names and hello to clean, developer-friendly files. Perfect for effortless handoff and collaboration!


✨ Key Features ✨


  1. Auto-Space Conversion: Automatically replace spaces in layer names with underscores (_) or remove them entirely for clean, code-friendly naming.
  2. Batch Rename Layers: Rename multiple layers in seconds, saving time and improving efficiency.
  3. Flexible Naming Styles: Supports hyphens, underscores, camel case, kebab case, and more to fit your coding standards.
  4. Instant Updates: Apply changes with a single click—no need for tedious manual edits.
  5. Streamlined Handoff: Deliver developer-ready files with consistent, clean layer names for seamless collaboration.
plugins.tagline: Rename layers for seamless developer handoff

plugins.name: Sierotki Eliminator
plugins.description:
Sierotki Eliminator tackles a common issue in Polish typography known as "sierotki" (literally "orphans"). In Polish texts, single-letter words like "a", "i", "o", "u", "w", or "z" at the end of a line are considered typographic errors.


This plugin automatically replaces the space after these single-letter words with a non-breaking space, ensuring they always stay with the following word. By eliminating "sierotki", it enhances the visual appeal and readability of your Polish text in Figma designs.


Whether you're a Polish designer or working on Polish-language projects, Sierotki Eliminator helps you maintain proper typography.
plugins.tagline: Remove single-letter words at the end of a line

plugins.name: Archiver
plugins.description:
Archiver is a streamlined utility that helps you declutter your Figma workspace without losing valuable design history. With a single click, it automatically moves selected elements to a dedicated Archive page, organizing them chronologically by date.


Unlike manual archiving, this plugin:

  1. Preserves all properties including auto layout, components, and text styling
  2. Intelligently arranges archived items by date for easy retrieval
  3. Handles any element type (frames, components, vectors, text, etc.)
  4. Works with batch selections for efficient cleanup
  5. Maintains a clear naming convention with date stamps


Perfect for design teams that need to keep their working files clean while maintaining access to previous iterations, explorations, or unused concepts. Simply select what you want to archive, run the plugin, and continue designing with a cleaner workspace.

plugins.name: State Machines
plugins.description:
Create state machines and integrate them directly into your designs.


What is a state machine?


Think of a state machine as a way to organize all the different "states" your design can be in. For example, a form might have states like "empty," "filled," "submitting," or "error." State machines help you clearly define these states and the rules for moving between them, making complex interactions more manageable.


---


This plugin is experimental. Contributions and feature requests welcome: github.com/colebemis/figma-state-machines

plugins.name: Chroma Forge
plugins.description:
Chroma Forge for Figma


A powerful color selection plugin for Figma that provides an intuitive color wheel and advanced color harmony tools to create consistent color palettes.


Features


Interactive Color Wheel

  1. High-precision color selection with a fully interactive color wheel
  2. Adjustable brightness and saturation sliders
  3. Real-time color preview
  4. HEX code input with validation


Color Harmony Tools

  1. Create cohesive color palettes using different harmony types:
  2. Analogous: Colors that are adjacent to each other on the color wheel
  3. Triad: Three colors evenly spaced around the color wheel
  4. Complementary: Colors opposite each other on the color wheel
  5. Split Complementary: A main color and two colors adjacent to its complement
  6. Square: Four colors evenly spaced around the color wheel
  7. Compound: A combination of complementary and analogous harmonies
  8. Mono: A single color with various shades
  9. Custom: Create your own custom harmony by placing markers freely


Flexible Color Selection

  1. Select 2-6 colors at once (depending on harmony type)
  2. Drag markers on the wheel to fine-tune your color selection
  3. Automatic contrast adjustment for optimal visibility


Figma Integration

  1. Apply selected colors directly to selected elements
  2. Create color styles from your palette
  3. Generate color variables with automatic shade variants (10% to 100% brightness)
  4. Intelligent naming system for organizing colors


How to Use


Select a Harmony Type: Choose from the dropdown menu to define how colors relate to each other

Select Number of Colors: Choose how many colors you want in your palette (2-6)

Choose Your Base Color: Click and drag on the color wheel or enter a HEX code

Adjust Saturation and Brightness: Use the sliders to fine-tune your colors

Apply Colors: Use the buttons to:

  1. Apply directly to selected elements
  2. Add to Figma color styles
  3. Add to Figma variables (with automatic shade creation)


Email me

Dribbble

LinkedIn

accepted.name: Andrei Kuznetsov
accepted.description: Templates, UI Kits, Design Systems, Plugins

Description

Testing with real-life data is crucial, but setting up prototypes manually is time-consuming. With AI Real Data Generator Figma plugin, simply provide AI with your instructions and an example—using your Gemini API key, it will instantly generate and replace data in your design, making prototyping seamless and efficient.


How to Use:

  1. Add the AI Real Data Generator plugin in Figma.
  2. Enter your Gemini API key to enable data generation.
  3. Provide instructions on the type of real-life data you need.
  4. Provide an example or data template to guide AI generation.
  5. AI instantly generates and replaces data directly in your Figma design.


Key Features:


  1. Instant data generation: AI quickly fills in real-world data in seconds.
  2. Customizable: Provide specific instructions and examples to match your needs.
  3. Seamless integration: Data replaces existing placeholders in your design automatically.
  4. Efficiency boost: Save time on manual data entry during prototyping.
  5. Powered by Gemini API: Leverage advanced AI for precise data generation, enabled with the free gemini-2.0-flash modal

plugins.name: Codex — Repository-Aware Code Generator powered by AI
plugins.description:
Codex is an AI powered code generator that learns your existing repo. You can import your repository, and Codex will generate code in your used framework, using your styles and configurations. It works with any framework or language. No setup necessary — just import with one click and go!


Features


Code just like you wrote it yourself

Codex will adapt its code generation to the conventions and code style used across your repo. It will read config files and use the same libraries and frameworks you use in your project.


Refine your export further

Need to use a specific component? Instruct Codex to change your code and get a refined result, without losing the context. You can also do this multiple times, until you’re 100% happy.


Learns your repository with a one-click-import

You don’t have to map your figma components to your design system. Codex automatically recognizes which components you have implemented or installed and will use those for generating code.


Generates code in any framework or language

Any language, library or framework you are using in your repo will be used by Codex to generate code from Figma.


Learns from your feedback

As you refine your exports, Codex will remember your feedback and apply it to future code generations.


FAQ


Who is it for?

Codex is targeted at professional front end developers to speed up their workflows.


Does my figma file need special preparation?

No, but it works much better if all frames use auto layout.


Which frameworks are supported?

Codex is framework-agnostic. This means it can generate code in any language, for any framework. However, popular frameworks like React and Vue work best, as LLMs have more training data on them.


Can I use it without a repository?

Currently, no. But you can create a repository and initialize it with an empty skeleton in the framework of your choice, then Codex will generate code for that framework.


Does it work with monorepos?

If there is only one frontend package in the repo, likely yes. Better monorepo support is on the roadmap.


Does it only work in dev mode/design mode?

Codex works in both figma modes.


Does it only work with Github?

Currently, yes. Other providers coming soon.


Pricing


Check our pricing page for information on plans.
plugins.tagline: The code generator that understands your repository

plugins.name: Find and Replace Screens
plugins.description:
Find and Replace Screens is a tool designed to streamline the process of updating screens in Figma with just one click. Whether you're transitioning from wireframes to final UI designs or updating screens across an entire flow, this plugin saves you time by keeping your layout, connectors, and arrows intact. No more manual re-positioning or reconnecting screens!


Key features:

  1. One-Click screen replacement: Update multiple instances of the same screen with a single action, ideal for projects where the same screen is used in multiple places.
  2. Preserves layout and flow: Replacing a screen won't disturb its surrounding elements, including arrows, connectors, and positions within the flow.
  3. Flexible use case: While perfect for wireframe-to-UI transitions, the plugin is also useful for updating iterations of any design screen without losing structure.


How to Use:

  1. Choose the new screen you want to use (UI design, updated iteration, etc.).
  2. Select the screen(s) you want to replace in the flow.
  3. Click "Replace Screen" to swap the content while maintaining connections and layout positions.


Limitations:

  1. For best results, ensure the new screens are similar in size to the ones being replaced, as large size differences may affect layout alignment.
  2. Does not adjust connectors/arrows if the new screen's size significantly differs from the original.
plugins.tagline: Find and Replace Screens across your project with one click while keeping connections intact.

plugins.name: iconSync
plugins.description:
Simplify your design-to-development workflow by seamlessly integrating Figma with GitHub, ensuring Figma remains your single source of truth.


You can find the implementation in Github


1. Introduction

`icon-sync` is a powerful tool designed to bridge the gap between design and development.

It enables effortless synchronization of icon assets from Figma directly into a GitHub repository.

With minimal setup and a highly intuitive workflow, `icon-sync` ensures that design assets remain version-controlled, up-to-date, and accessible to the entire product team.


2. Why icon-sync?

Managing design assets—especially icons—can become chaotic across growing teams and projects.

Designers work in Figma, while developers often rely on versioned assets stored in GitHub. This disconnect can lead to:


Outdated assets being used in production.

Manual, error-prone handoffs.

Lack of traceability in design changes.


`icon-sync` solves these issues by automating the synchronization of icons from Figma to GitHub, removing the need for repetitive manual exports and uploads.

It aligns the design and engineering workflows and helps establish Figma as the canonical source for icon assets.


3. Features

🎯 One-Click GitHub Integration

Push your icons from Figma to GitHub in a single action. No more file downloads or commit commands.


🧠 Smart Change Detection

Only changed or new icons are processed, ensuring minimal diffs and cleaner version history.


🔁 Automated Pull Request Generation

Every sync automatically generates a pull request containing updated icons and metadata, complete with commit messages and diffs.


4. Installation & Configuration

⚙️ Prerequisites:

Install `icon-sync` Figma plugin

A GitHub access token


Step 1: Install the Plugin

Install the `icon-sync` Figma plugin from the Figma community.


Step 2: GitHub Access Token Setup


To use `icon-sync`, you must provide a GitHub Access Token. There are two options depending on your preference and security requirements:


Option 1: Personal Access Token (Classic)

If you're using a Personal Access Token, make sure to grant the repo.


⚠️ This approach is simple but grants broad access to your repositories. Use with caution if you have sensitive data or multiple repositories under the same account.


Option 2: Fine-Grained Personal Access Token (Recommended)

If you're using a Fine-Grained Access Token, you'll need to specify individual repository permissions, Make sure to select the following:


Contents → `Read and write`

Allows access to files and blobs in the repository, which is required for uploading icons.


Metadata → `Read-only`

Allows the plugin to retrieve basic repository information.


Pull Requests → `Read and write`

Enables the plugin to automatically create and update pull requests.


5. Usage

Once installed and configured, using `icon-sync` is straightforward.


Step 1: Environment Setup

After launching the `icon-sync` plugin, navigate to the **GitHub** tab.


You’ll see several input fields you need to fill out:

Owner – your GitHub username or organization name

API Key – your GitHub access token

Main Branch Name – usually `main` or `master`

Compare Branch Name – a branch to create for the pull request (e.g., `icon/update`)

Repository Name – the target GitHub repository

Store Path – the directory in the repo where icons should be stored (e.g., `icons/`)


Once you complete these fields, you’re ready to import icons.


Note: These settings are saved locally after the first setup, so you won’t need to re-enter them every time you open the plugin.


Step 2: Import Icons from Figma

You have **two options** to import icons from your Figma file:


Option 1: Auto-Import from Current Page

As soon as the plugin launches, it will automatically scan the **current Figma page** and import all icons that are structured as components.


Option 2: Frame-Based Import

Alternatively, you can:


1. Create a Frame in your Figma file.

2. Select the Frame.

3. Click the "Import Icons" button in the plugin.


This will import only the icons within the selected Frame.


Step 3: Deploy to GitHub

Once you've finished both steps above, you're ready to deploy your icons to GitHub.


Click the Deploy button to start the upload process.

`icon-sync` will automatically commit the icons and open a pull request in your repository.

After deployment, a "Go to GitHub" button will appear. Click it to jump directly to the pull request and review the changes.
plugins.tagline: Sync icons from Figma to GitHub

plugins.name: Icon Resizer
plugins.description:
The Icon Resizer Plugin is a powerful tool designed for designers who need to resize and create multiple versions of icons quickly and efficiently. Whether you’re working on UI/UX design, branding, or graphic design, the plugin helps streamline the process of resizing icons into various sizes while maintaining design integrity.

The plugin allows users to duplicate and resize selected icons to predefined sizes (e.g., 16px, 24px, 32px, 40px, 48px) with just a few clicks. You can choose a single size or add up to five different sizes in one go.
